datasetVersion.disclaimer: Geographic files adapted from Statistics Canada, Census Subdivisions Cartographic Boundary File, 2001 Census, Second Edition, 2002. This does not constitute an endorsement by Statistics Canada of this product.

fields.value: CCRI 1911 Census of Canada: Aggregate data and geography = CCRI 1911 Recensement du Canada: Données agrégées et cadre géographique

dsDescriptionValue.value: This study includes two components of the research infrastructure developed by CCRI for the 1911 Census of Canada: selected digitized published tables of aggregate data and a reconstruction of the census geography.

value: See also the CCRI Census of Canada materials for 1921, 1931, 1941 and 1951.

Marc St-Hilaire , Byron Moldofsky , Laurent Richard & Mariange Beaudry (2007): Geocoding and Mapping Historical Census Data: The Geographical Component of the Canadian Century Research Infrastructure, Historical Methods: A Journal of Quantitative and Interdisciplinary History, 40:2, 76-91. http://dx.doi.org/10.3200/HMTS.40.2.76-91

files.description: Summary of all tables from the 1911 to 1951 censuses digitized by the CCRI.

dataFile.description: Summary of all tables from the 1911 to 1951 censuses digitized by the CCRI.

files.description: Table: 1911, Vol. 1, Table 1. Title: Area and population of Canada by provinces, districts and subdistricts in 1911 and population in 1901. Source: Canada. Dominion Bureau of Statistics. 1911. Fifth Census of Canada. Ottawa: King's Printer, Vol. 1, Table 1, pp. 2-172. Basic unit of geography: Census subdistrict (CSD).
files.label: ccri_pub_1911_v1t1.xls

dataFile.description: Table: 1911, Vol. 1, Table 1. Title: Area and population of Canada by provinces, districts and subdistricts in 1911 and population in 1901. Source: Canada. Dominion Bureau of Statistics. 1911. Fifth Census of Canada. Ottawa: King's Printer, Vol. 1, Table 1, pp. 2-172. Basic unit of geography: Census subdistrict (CSD).

files.description: Table: 1911, Vol. 1, Table 2. Title: Conjugal condition of the people, classified as single, married, widowed, divorced, legally separated and not given, by districts and sub-districts. Source: Canada. Dominion Bureau of Statistics. 1911. Fifth Census of Canada. Ottawa: King's Printer, Vol. 1, Table 2, pp. 174-511. Basic unit of geography: Census subdistrict (CSD).
files.label: ccri_pub_1911_v1t2.xls

files.description: Table: 1911, Vol. 2, Table 28. Title: Literacy of total population 5 years of age and over. Source: Canada. Dominion Bureau of Statistics. 1911. Fifth Census of Canada. Ottawa: King's Printer, Vol. 2, Table 28, pp. 462-466. Basic unit of geography: Census district (CD).

files.description: Boundary polygon files in ESRI "shape file" format that reconstruct the census compilation and dissemination geography  for the 1911 at the Census division (CD) level of geography. A NAP metadata record in .xml format is included.
files.label: CCRI_Shapefiles_CD_1911.zip

dataFile.description: Boundary polygon files in ESRI "shape file" format that reconstruct the census compilation and dissemination geography  for the 1911 at the Census division (CD) level of geography. A NAP metadata record in .xml format is included.

datasetVersion.citation: Gaffield, Chad; Baskerville, Peter; St-Hilaire, Marc; Amrhein, Carl; Cadigan, Sean; Moldofsky, Byron; Darroch, Gordon; Bellavance, Claude; Normand, France, 2015, "CCRI 1911 Census of Canada: Aggregate data and geography = CCRI 1911 Recensement du Canada: Données agrégées et cadre géographique", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10269, UAL Dataverse, V1
